intro: Randia zollingeri, commonly known as Zollinger's randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and glossy, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Randia zollingeri is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
